name: Dirty Rotten Holograms
description: Things are not what they seem when Deep Space Nine takes on the look of 1960s Las Vegas! Sabotage is suspected, but is it one of the usual suspects? And for what purpose?
rules:
-- Unique Supply Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Kira, Tolar, Mudd, or Holograms will provide a bonus to Supply Missions.
-- Every Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are only available during Phase 1. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Kira, Tolar, Mudd, or Holograms
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Supply Missions!

adventures.description: Gain the new access codes to enter the holosuites.

adventures.description: Find a map to the version of Las Vegas masking the station.

adventures.description: Grab a matchbox from the Dunes for a keepsake!

action.name: All The Time In The World!
It Will Pass. You'll See. It Will Pass.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

goals.flavor: Hit the town with those ice-cold Cardassians.
Get in on all the scams with the Romulan Star Empire.
Make some dough with the Ferengi Traditionalists.

screens.text: "Never thought I'd be pullin' the old 1960s Earth Las Vegas shtick again. Maybe Doctor Bashir's Vic Fontaine program is on the fritz, but the whole station has changed, so it seems too major to be a holo-glitch."

"I doubt this is a glitch. The whole station's made up like the Vegas strip. Seems deliberate. Probably a scam run by the Romulans, or the Cardassians. Both are full of punks and finks who'd try something crooked like this. Only question is why?"
"You got me there, pallie. But if we're gonna get any answers, we'll need to jive on over to Quark's--or, The Dunes of Ferenginar, as it's being called now."
"The broad's right. You in, Captain? You'll have to make sure you blend in, of course. You don't want these harveys makin' you."
"Shoulda known a shlub like you woulda been behind this, Tolar. Get your mits off that holo-emitter! Whose payroll are you on this time?"
"Payroll? I don't know what you mean or why you're talking like that, but a professional never reveals his benefactors."
"You can either tell us what punk put you up to this, pallie, or I can reveal your face to the inside of a holo-reactor. Set this clod straight, Captain!"
"I don't know what you're talking about, but why would the Cardassians want the entire station masked in a holoprogram? They're pretty direct, if you ask me. Brutally so."
"What would the Romulans want with a mild-mannered holo-forger, really?"

"The Ferengi? Well, I can see your logic. That Quark fellow is milking the casino set-up for all it's worth. Did you see how much he's charging for synthale? Synthale! Just because he's serving it in one of your Earth martini glasses with an olive. It's criminal."
"Knock off the jokes, pallie! I don't care who you're workin' for. If you don't put the station back to normal now, I'll put you out the airlock, you dig?"

"Ow! Put me down! It's not that simple. The array of holo-emitters I've set up is far more advanced than your standard holosuite! It'll take more than the handful of us. Maybe the Captain there can manage to round up some help."
